definition: prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: The hijacking of the Alabama is believed the first pirate attack on an American-flagged merchant ship in 200 years.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉巴马被看做200年来第一艘被劫的美国船只。

sentences.english: Alabama is now college football's number-one-ranked team.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉巴马大学现在成为了大学橄榄球联赛的领头羊。

sentences.english: and it may be more accurate than we think, according to the researchers at the University of Alabama.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉巴马大学的研究人员认为这句古语也许比我们。

sentences.english: Itnever did, and there are no Alabama sturgeons in captivity.
sentences.chinese: 但人们的希望落空了，阿拉巴马鲟鱼再也没有出现过。

sentences.english: King then led a new revolution in Birmingham, Alabama.
sentences.chinese: 然后金在阿拉巴马洲的伯明翰领导了一场新的革命。

sentences.english: This course is taught at University of Alabama.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程由美国阿拉巴马大学开设。

pinyin: Bin1 xi1 fa3 ni2 ya4 zhou1
